SENT.plain: The authors report a 9-year-old girl with mid-facial hypoplasia, maxillary hypoplasia, prognathia, microbrachycephaly, mouth opening and protruding tongue
She also had psychomotor retardation such as mental retardation and speech delay
Frequent laughter fits and seizure disorder was also noted
Although the high resolution chromosome study failed to demonstrate any deletion of chromosome 15q, the clinical picture was compatible with Angelman syndrome
Breast development at the age of six and rapid progression of bone age was noted at follow up
After a series of examinations, the diagnosis of gonadotropin-dependent precocious puberty was made
MRI of brain revealed an intermediate cyst in the pituitary gland and slightly enlarged pineal gland
However, serum alpha-fetoprotein and beta-HCG were undetectable and the size of the pineal gland remained the same at the 1-year follow-up
She was treated with long-acting GnRH analogue and valproic acid
The combination of precocious puberty and Angelman syndrome has not been reported before and such association needs further experience for clarification
